metaDescription: Find top-rated financial advisors in Roswell. Expert guidance for retirement planning, wealth management, and investment strategies.

advisors.name: Edward Jones - Financial Advisor: James McClelland
Edward Jones - Financial Advisor: Wes Belding, CFP®|CRPC™

heroDescription: Roswell, NM, known for its UFO lore, is a vibrant city with a rich cultural heritage and a growing economy.
landscapeDescription: With a population of 48,611, Roswell's economy is primarily driven by agriculture, healthcare, and tourism. The city is diversifying its economic base to attract new industries.
uniqueNeeds: Roswell requires tailored financial services to support its unique economic landscape and demographic trends.
citySpecificRiskAdvice: Roswell's economy relies on agriculture and tourism, posing risks from climate change and market fluctuations. Real estate may face volatility; diversify investments to mitigate risks.

sections.title: Economic Growth
sections.description: According to BEA (2023), Roswell's GDP growth is steady, driven by agriculture and healthcare sectors, with a focus on sustainable practices.

sections.title: Wealth Demographics
sections.description: According to Census (2023), the median income in Roswell is $45,000, reflecting the economic challenges faced by many residents.

sections.title: Advisor Specializations
sections.description: Based on BLS (2023), financial advisors in Roswell are increasingly focusing on retirement planning and agricultural investments.

sections.title: Cost of Living
sections.description: According to BLS (2024), Roswell's cost of living is lower than the national average, making it an attractive place for families and retirees.

sections.title: Real Estate Market
sections.description: According to Zillow (2024), Roswell's real estate market is stable, but there are concerns about potential overvaluation in certain neighborhoods.

sections.title: Business Environment
sections.description: According to Fortune (2024), Roswell is fostering a supportive business climate with incentives for new startups and small businesses.
